questions.question: Your company is facing a financial crisis. The leadership proposes cutting employee benefits to reduce costs. As a manager, how do you respond?

a.text: Analyze financial data to suggest alternative cost-cutting strategies.

b.text: Discuss the proposal with employees to gauge their concerns.

c.text: Support the decision to protect the company despite dissatisfaction.

d.text: Reflect on your values and consider resigning if you disagree.

questions.question: A key team member is going through a personal crisis, affecting their performance on a critical project. How do you handle the situation?

a.text: Offer flexible deadlines and emotional support to ease their workload.

b.text: Reassign tasks to balance the project timeline without burdening them.

c.text: Encourage them to take a break, prioritizing their well-being.

d.text: Keep them accountable to maintain team productivity.

questions.question: You discover confidential information that a colleague is leaking sensitive data to a competitor. Reporting it may ruin their career but ignoring it risks the company. What do you do?

a.text: Gather evidence and report the issue to upper management.

b.text: Confront the colleague privately to understand their motives.

c.text: Reflect on the ethical implications before acting.

d.text: Ignore it to avoid damaging workplace relationships.
